1 Timothy__02.1: I desire therefore, first of all, that supplications, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings be made for all men:
1 Timothy__02.2: For kings, and for all that are in high station: that we may lead a quiet and a peaceable life in all piety and chastity.
1 Timothy__02.3: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour,
1 Timothy__02.4: Who will have all men to be saved, and to come to the knowledge of the truth.
1 Timothy__02.5: For there is one God, and<u>one mediator</u>of God and men, the man Christ Jesus:
1 Timothy__02.6: Who gave himself<u>a redemption for all</u>, a testimony in due times.
1 Timothy__02.7: Whereunto I am appointed a preacher and an apostle, (I say the truth, I lie not,) a doctor of the Gentiles in faith and truth.
1 Timothy__02.8: I will therefore that men pray in every place, lifting up pure hands, without anger and contention.
1 Timothy__02.9: In like manner women also in decent apparel: adorning themselves with modesty and sobriety, not with plaited hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly attire,
1 Timothy__02.10: But as it becometh women professing godliness, with good works.
1 Timothy__02.11: Let the woman learn in silence, with all subjection.
1 Timothy__02.12: But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to use authority over the man: but to be in silence.
1 Timothy__02.13: For Adam was first formed; then Eve.
1 Timothy__02.14: And Adam was not seduced; but the woman being seduced, was in the transgression.
1 Timothy__02.15: Yet she shall be saved through childbearing; if she continue in faith, and love, and sanctification, with sobriety.
